Entries.default: The crowd's continued applause slowly dims into a distant hum. As the din fades, the apparition you saw above the valley congeals before you.
"How many desperate souls have spent the last shred of their existence in futile attempts to end yours?"
"But then, you do reflect Toamowhai in tooth, claw, and horn."
"Until only the will to survive remains."
"You again? What do you want?"
"What imperfections? Rampant modesty is hardly a flaw."
"Do you reveal yourself to all the contenders, or is it just me?"
"The more you tell me what's going on, the better I can assist you."
"How many more victories will it take to sate your curiosity?"
"I want only for the Crucible to endure. It cannot if the souls rage against one another."
"They will open a path only to a champion, and only a Watcher can walk it."
"Not all weaknesses are physical."
"I've heard enough."
"Each season, the Faces choose their favorites. Not all hear us as clearly as you."
"The heart of the Crucible has clotted. The flow of souls has been choked."
"But I am as a fish attempting to describe the current. This will all be clear when seen with your own eyes."
"I am not the one you must impress."
"The deciding matches draw near. Fight with Toamowhai in your heart, and you will outlast all opposition."
The silhouette of the aumaua blurs, their features congealing into a uniform glow that dissipates into nothing as the roar of the crowd rushes back into your ears.
"Another, a woman in robes, also revealed herself to me."
"I encountered another of your kind after dealing with the stelgaer in the lowveld."
"The Seeking Face lurks above the slaughter she helped create."
"The Slaying Face, the embodiment of Toamowhai's passion for the kill."
"He was one of the rare champions to achieve victory in the Crucible without a pack."
"Still, you endure."
"As each strike of the stone sharpens an obsidian blade, so too does each battle chisel away one's imperfections."
"So the Slaying Face was once a living kith?"
"Of course. As were we all."
"All who?"
"The Faces of the Hunt."
"Those who perish here no longer feed Kazuwari their strength, but instead infest it with disharmony."
